channel.title: Investing in Gold and Silver With The American Advisor
channel.description: A daily (Mon - Fri) show and podcast covering investing in gold and silver, plus business news, finance, and the economy.
channel.itunes:author: Goldline International
channel.itunes:summary: Investing in Gold and Silver With The American Advisor is a daily show and podcast that discusses a wide variety of important topics including personal finance, the economy, precious metals--like gold and silver--and business news. The show regularly covers current events which shape our economy and offers frank discussions on issues that you will not often hear on mainstream news radio sources.

item.title: Precious Metals Market Update 06.04.12
item.description: Morgan Stanley has increased the likelihood that the Federal Reserve will implement a third round of quantitative easing from 50 percent to 80 percent given last week’s disappointing U.S. jobs report. We discuss this and what it could mean for gold and silver.

item.title: Precious Metals Week in Review with Joe Battaglia 06.01.12
item.description: Joe Battaglia discussed this week’s precious metals and economic news including: rising gold and silver prices; weak US employment data; the Facebook IPO; the European banking crisis; Moody’s downgrade of Danish banks; Spain tries to save Bankia; fiat currencies vs gold backed currencies; the possibility of QE3; gold as a safe-haven asset; central banks gold purchases; analyst price targets for gold and silver.

item.title: Precious Metals Week in Review with Joe Battaglia 05.25.12
item.description: Joe Battaglia discussed this week’s precious metals and economic news including: the possibility that the gold correction is over; Facebook’s IPO; oil prices dropping; runs on Spanish banks; JP Morgan losses grow by another $1 billion; central banks and hedge funds continue to add gold to their holdings; Moody’s downgrades 16 Spanish banks; investing in silver; EU summit declares desire for Greece to remain in Eurozone; possibility of Eurozone crisis boosting gold prices; possible return to the gold standard; analyst price targets for gold and silver.

item.title: Precious Metals Market Update 05.23.12
item.description: The technical analysts at BofA Merrill Lynch recently wrote:"Gold has pulled back to test support at $1550-1500. This support is holding, which sets up gold for a rally... Our longer-term view remains that gold is in a secular bull market with upside potential to $2000-2300 to as high as $3000 in coming years."
